item.title: California Girl Brain Dead
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: Jahi McMath, 13, had a tonsillectomy to correct a form of sleep apnea. After complications, "she is 100% brain damaged. Medically dead," her uncle says.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:5:{s:5:"width";i:280;s:6:"height";i:420;s:4:"file";s:34:"2014/03/PointClick-Photography.jpg";s:5:"sizes";a:3:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:34:"PointClick-Photography-150x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:150;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:34:"PointClick-Photography-200x300.jpg";s:5:"width";i:200;s:6:"height";i:300;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:14:"post-thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:34:"PointClick-Photography-280x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:280;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:11:{s:8:"aperture";i:0;s:6:"credit";s:27:"Point&Click Photography";s:6:"camera";s:0:"";s:7:"caption";s:152:"Jahi McMath, 13, had a tonsillectomy to correct a form of sleep apnea. item.title: Sylvia & Joe BoardwalkA.JPG
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: Family photos showing Sylvia Sodden. Esther Feigenbaum saved her elderly sister, Sylvia Sodden, 78, from certain death Tuesday by filing a lawsuit that stopped Sodden's godson from pulling the plug on the respirator keeping her alive. -----Original Message----- From: Saul, Joshua Sent: Tuesday, March 18, 2014 6:42 PM To: Sloane, Neil Cc: PhotoDesk Subject: CATHOLIC VS JEW LIFE SUPPORT FIGHT photos -- the boardwalk one is great. Photo if you want higher quality photos you can call Joe and Nina at 203-255-9734 and instruct them on how to send higher quality photos. Josh Saul Brooklyn Supreme Court 718.797.9724 ________________________________________ From: Nina Arrigo [narrigo203@optonline.net] Sent: Tuesday, March 18, 2014 6:39 PM To: Saul, Joshua Cc: jrarrigo@aol.com; narrigo203@gmail.com Subject: Photos of Sylvia & Joe Josh, Attached are the photos, any problems let me know and I can send separately.
item.excerpt:encoded: Sylvia Soddden and Joe Arrigo via The New York Post.

item.title: Noah's Ark on Mount Ararat
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: c3105071 - 31st May 2007 - Mount Ararat, Turkey. Greenpeace turning the Ark over to the public in an official ceremony . One day before, a group of climbers at the 5,137-meter summit of Mount Ararat has called on the leaders of all nations to make climate protection a reality. Greenpeace Noah's Ark was build on Mount Ararat, the biblical mountain, to warn of impending climate disaster. Greenpeace has finished the construction of a new Noah's Ark on Mount Ararat at an elevation of 2,500 meters. Measuring ten by four meters, the ship has being built to remind leaders of all nations, shortly before the G8 summit in Heiligendamm, that there's not much time left to mitigate a climate disaster with devastating consequences for all. ©Greenpeace/Manuel Citak GREENPEACE HANDOUT _ NO RESALE _ NO ARCHIVE _ OK FOR ONLINE REPRO
item.excerpt:encoded: Greenpeace's Ark on Mount Ararat (via greenpeace.org)

Greenpeace Noah's Ark was build on Mount Ararat, the biblical mountain, to warn of impending climate disaster. wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: a:5:{s:5:"width";i:800;s:6:"height";i:533;s:4:"file";s:28:"2014/05/Greenpeace-Ark-1.jpg";s:5:"sizes";a:6:{s:9:"thumbnail";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:28:"Greenpeace-Ark-1-150x150.jpg";s:5:"width";i:150;s:6:"height";i:150;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:6:"medium";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:28:"Greenpeace-Ark-1-300x200.jpg";s:5:"width";i:300;s:6:"height";i:200;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:12:"medium_large";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:28:"Greenpeace-Ark-1-768x512.jpg";s:5:"width";i:768;s:6:"height";i:512;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:6:"slider";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:28:"Greenpeace-Ark-1-800x450.jpg";s:5:"width";i:800;s:6:"height";i:450;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:8:"featured";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:28:"Greenpeace-Ark-1-690x462.jpg";s:5:"width";i:690;s:6:"height";i:462;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}s:14:"small-featured";a:4:{s:4:"file";s:28:"Greenpeace-Ark-1-390x261.jpg";s:5:"width";i:390;s:6:"height";i:261;s:9:"mime-type";s:10:"image/jpeg";}}s:10:"image_meta";a:12:{s:8:"aperture";s:2:"11";s:6:"credit";s:23:"Greenpeace/Manuel Citak";s:6:"camera";s:13:"Canon EOS 30D";s:7:"caption";s:828:"c3105071 - 31st May 2007 - Mount Ararat, Turkey. Greenpeace turning the Ark over to the public in an official ceremony . One day before, a group of climbers at the 5,137-meter summit of Mount Ararat has called on the leaders of all nations to make climate protection a reality. Greenpeace Noah's Ark was build on Mount Ararat, the biblical mountain, to warn of impending climate disaster. Greenpeace has finished the construction of a new Noah's Ark on Mount Ararat at an elevation of 2,500 meters. Measuring ten by four meters, the ship has being built to remind leaders of all nations, shortly before the G8 summit in Heiligendamm, that there's not much time left to mitigate a climate disaster with devastating consequences for all. ©Greenpeace/Manuel Citak GREENPEACE HANDOUT _ NO RESALE _ NO ARCHIVE _ OK FOR ONLINE REPRO";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1180549410";s:9:"copyright";s:23:"Greenpeace/Manuel Citak";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"195";s:3:"iso";s:3:"125";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:5:"0.005";s:5:"title";s:26:"Noah's Ark on Mount Ararat";s:11:"orientation";s:1:"1";s:8:"keywords";a:5:{i:0;s:23:"BERGE/GEBIRGE/MOUNTAINS";i:1;s:16:"AKTIONEN/ACTIONS";i:2;s:21:"GREENPEACE/GREENPEACE";i:3;s:31:"KLIMA/KLIMABEDINGUNGEN/KLIMATIS";i:4;s:20:"ceremony / Zeremonie";}}}

item.title: Morning panel
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Lonnie Isabel (left) moderates a panel discussion on global trends in press freedom at NYU's Journalism Institute, with (from left to right) Nina Ognianova, Kassahun Yilma, Marcela Turati and Roozbeh Mirebrahimi. May 3, 2013. Photo by Steve Latimer.

item.title: Suzanne Bilello
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: UNESCO's Suzanne Bilello welcomes the audience and participants to 'Information on Trial,' a daylong symposium to mark World Press Freedom Day. May 3, 2013. Photo by Steve Latimer.

item.title: Ann Cooper and George Packer
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Ann Cooper and George Packer in conversation at 'Information on Trial,' at NYU's Journalism Institute. May 3, 2013. Photo by Steve Latimer.

item.title: moment of silence
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.excerpt:encoded: Lonnie Isabel, Nina Ognianova, Marcela Turati, and Roozbeh Mirebrahimi and share a moment of silence, led by Kassahun Yilma, for journalists imprisoned and at risk around the world. May 3, 2013. Photo by Steve Latimer.

item.title: Brazil Rio Violence
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: Journalists take cover during a shooting against drug traffickers at the Complexo do Alemao slum in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Saturday, Nov. 27, 2010. Soldiers and police crouching behind armored vehicles trained their rifles on dozens of entrances to a sprawling slum Saturday, preparing to invade and try to push drug gangs out an area long considered the most dangerous in Rio de Janeiro, a city set to host the 2016 Olympics. (AP Photo/ Silvia Izquierdo)
item.excerpt:encoded: Image: Journalists take cover in a shootout between police and drug traffickers in Brazil. (AP/Silvia Izquierdo) via Committee to Protect Journalists.

item.title: 20_burma_rohingye_nachtwey_1463_8918_t
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded:
Rohingye people, a Muslim population, living in Rakhine State on the northwest coast of Burma have been restricted to their villages and placed in Internally Displaced Peoples (IDP) camps by the Burmese government. They have been the victims of persecution and communal violence by numbers of the Buddhist majority in Rakhine. International NGO's such as MSF have been expelled by the government, leading to a soaring crisis in health care.
Brick kilns operated by Rohingya IDP's. Workers are IDP's. Adults are paid 2,000 kyat per day for about 10m hours of work. Children are paid 1,000 kyat per day. Children in photos are from age 6 to 8 and the oldest is 14.
Funerals. First a 16 year old girl who drank poison. Sevcond a woman who died from stomach disease.
A blind beggar on railway tracks between two IDP camps.
Photograph by James Nachtwey.
item.excerpt:encoded: "Two men are seen mourning at the funeral of a woman who died from stomach disease." Photo by James Nachtwey for Time
